thread.title: Burlington Central boys golf 2nd in BNC
thread.title_full: Burlington Central boys golf 2nd in BNC

title: Burlington Central boys golf 2nd in BNC
text:
Burlington Central boys golf 2nd in BNC Published: Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015 10:35 p.m. CDT • Updated: Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015 11:08 p.m. CDT By KANE COUNTY CHRONICLE 
POPLAR GROVE – Burlington Central navigated cool, windy conditions Thursday to shoot a 337 at Timber Pointe Golf Club, finishing second in the Big Northern Conference boys golf meet. 
Genoa-Kingston, BC’s rival in the BNC East and the lone team to defeat the Rockets in duals this season, won with a 326. 
“We were hoping we could do a nice showing against Genoa today especially since they’re hosting our regional,” BC coach Tom Davies said. “We keep coming up short against them time and time again. Its a good measuring stick. They’re a good team.” 
Joe Sherman paced the Rockets with a 5-over par 77. 
“Joe’s been rock steady,” Davies said. “He was almost our No. 2 last year as a sophomore on a really deep team. So playing No. 1 … he’s got a very good average. Joe’s someone I don’t really worry about. Every time he goes out, I know Joe is going to bring in a nice number for the team.” 
Anthony Divito followed Sherman with an 82. 
Chicago Catholic League tournament: At Cog Hill in Lemont, St. Francis tied for third among 15 teams with a 315, led by co-medalist Jonathan Nocek’s 73. Loyola won with a 303, while Marmion was fifth with a 318. 
Joey Fremgen led Marmion with a 76, tying for fourth among individuals. 
DeKalb 159, St. Charles North 170: At Kishwaukee Country Club in DeKalb, North fell in nonconference play. 
GIRLS GOLF 
St. Charles North 151, Wheaton North 217: At Pottawatomie Golf Course in St. Charles, North set a new program record for low team score behind medalist Kate Lillie’s 35. Gianna Furrie (37) and Megan Furtney (38) followed. 
GIRLS VOLLEYBALL 
Neuqua Valley def. St. Charles East, 2-1 (24-26, 25-14, 25-17): At St. Charles, Avery Macklin and Klaudia Sowizral both had eight kills for East (15-6). 
St. Charles North def. Waubonsie Valley, 2-1 (15-25, 25-22, 25-16): At Aurora, Claire Anderson (14 kills) and Daley Krage (13) powered the attack for 19-3 North. 
Geneva def. Cary-Grove (13-25, 25-17, 25-22): At Cary, Geneva (19-2) rallied for a nonconference win. A Kyley Thompson kill gave the Vikings a 23-22 lead in the third set. 
GIRLS TENNIS 
St. Charles North 7, Larkin 0: At Elgin, North cruised to its fifth successive victory, winning each doubles match, 6-0, 6-0. Shelby Thomas won at No. 1 singles by the same score. 
Kaneland 4, Plainfield Central 3: At Maple Park, Kaneland’s Brittany Zablocki and Haley Plach earned victories at the top two singles spots. 
Batavia 6, Elgin 1: At Elgin, Batavia’s Sam Fossali and Claire Stack won, 6-1, 6-0 in fourth doubles. 
BOYS SOCCER
